meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! I'm back to review the highly-anticipated Elden Ring, and I must say, this FromSoftware masterpiece has left me...well, a little impressed.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What's with all these perfect scores from other critics?" Well, let me tell you, it takes a lot more than just flapping your arms to get those 100s! As someone who's not exactly the most...ahem...seasoned gamer (read: old and grumpy), I'll give you my two cents on whether Elden Ring lives up to the hype.

So, what makes this game so special? For starters, it's got an open world that's as vast as a hippo's appetite. Exploring this realm of wonders is a blast – you'll stumble upon hidden secrets, discover new lands, and uncover the mysteries behind the world's decay. And did I mention the combat? Oh boy, it's like playing a game of "Hippo-Sized" whack-a-mole ( minus the mole...and the whacking...and the size... okay, you get it!) – it's fast-paced, intense, and requires strategy to take down those pesky enemies. Who knew being a grok could be so cool?!

But what really sets Elden Ring apart is its ability to balance challenge with accessibility. New players will find themselves gradually building up their skills, while veterans like me (ahem) can appreciate the refined combat mechanics that'll keep us on our toes.

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "What about the story?" Ah, yes! The narrative's a real treat – it's like a delicious hippo-sized bowl of mixed berries: sweet, tart, and full of surprises. You'll find yourself getting attached to characters and motivations that drive the world forward.

In conclusion, Elden Ring is an absolute delight for anyone who loves action-RPGs. Even this old grok can get on board with its sheer scale, engaging combat, and captivating story. So, what are you waiting for? Get your hippo-self out there and start exploring!
